newsitem.title: USA: Kanawha Cty, W. Va., plans fall bond referendum.
newsitem.headline: Kanawha Cty, W. Va., plans fall bond referendum.

text.p: West Virginia's Kanawha County School Board voted this week to put a $94 million bond referendum before voters no sooner than September and no later than November, school officials said Friday.
The school board said it would set the exact date next month.

The proposal has been pushed back and scaled down considerably. The district's Blue Ribbon Panel originally recommended a redistricting plan that called for $246 million in bonds to finance construction of up to 20 new schools, with a referendum as early as May.
School officials feared the proposal would never pass. Kanawha County voters rejected a proposed $73 million school bond issue in 1993.
Under the revised $94 million plan, bond proceeds would finance renovation and new equipment at numerous schools under a plan that also calls for consolidation and redistricting.
